meanings.definition: A person or thing that stacks.
meanings.sent1: The stackers neatly arranged the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse employed several stackers to organize the inventory.
meanings.sent3: The stackers at the grocery store had a competition to see who could build the tallest tower of cans.
meanings.sent4: She was a stacker of emotions, carefully piling one feeling on top of another.
meanings.sent5: The stackers in the game were colorful blocks that had to be arranged strategically.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used for stacking.
meanings.sent1: The stackers in the factory efficiently piled boxes on top of each other.
meanings.sent2: The automated stackers in the warehouse saved time and labor.
meanings.sent3: The stackers malfunctioned and started stacking items in random patterns.
meanings.sent4: The stackers hummed softly as they lifted and placed the crates with precision.
meanings.sent5: The stackers in the construction site were like giant metal arms reaching for the sky.

meanings.definition: A type of food item consisting of layers of ingredients stacked on top of each other.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious stackers dish with layers of cheese, tomatoes, and lettuce.
meanings.sent2: The menu featured a variety of stackers including burgers and sandwiches.
meanings.sent3: The stackers at the buffet were disappearing quickly as guests piled their plates high.
meanings.sent4: The towering stackers of pancakes were drizzled with syrup and topped with fresh berries.
meanings.sent5: The stackers of nachos were a hit at the party, with each layer adding a burst of flavor.
